stack writes:
> The '.invalid' is added when we get any IOException writing an arc 
> record.  The ARC is closed and given the '.invalid' suffix.

Makes sense.

> The 29 'gz.opens' is odd.  Are your disks healthy Tom?  (dmesg?)  Did 
> you run out of disk space?

Ah, disk space. Yes, that appears to have been the problem. The arcs
directory was 43G when things died. Unfortunately the state directory
weighed in at 63G, which killed me. I should have thought of that.

<sigh>

Well, I have enough raw data for the work I was doing: it's a pitty
the state directory is so big. Guess I need to get around to writing
that script to keep the ARCs on a separate disk from the rest.

Thanks.

    -tree
